Description: Fragment of a cylindrical black and white granite artefact, broken at both ends, probably a drill-core, by-product of bead or amulet (?) manufacture.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but probably from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list. On "drill-cores from tubular drillings", "alabaster, obsidian, syenite, basalt & jasper" from Tell Dafana, see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70. 18477 should be a "syenite" one. See other drill-cores from the site, calcite: London, BM, EA 23832 and 23833, London, PM, UC 72458 (4 items); Boston, MFA, RES 87.116-117 (2 items); jasper: Boston, MFA, RE 87.114-115 (2 items) ; syenite: Boston, MFA, 87.118. See also London, BM, EA 18475, 18476, 18478 and 18480, also very probably from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.88, p.188, pl.30)
